intro: Centropogon weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's grassveld, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
